results.title: The American soldier = Der Americkanische soldat
results.brief_description: In what Fassbinder describes as a ‘study of a perfect killer’ his American soldier is actually a German, recently returned from Vietnam with some newly developed skills to exploit. Stepping into the Munich underworld as a hired killer, Ricky (in his white suit and soft hat, one of the many movie references scattered throughout this noir-influenced thriller) finds he has entered a world of bluff and double-bluff, from the opening card game to the closing pay-off. Although the characters may be familiar from earlier Fassbinder films - the ageing rent-boy, the fickle moll, and unsmiling, sadistic policemen - the director has added a significance and weight to their cliched behaviour and stereotypical actions that invest the film with a knowing cynicism and a very dark humour. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: The American road
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Ford Motor Company, this film traces the development of American highways over the last 50 years. It tells the story of man’s method of transportation and how it has influenced his life, business, health and recreation. Includes archival footage of the early days of Henry Ford’s factory, such as the creation of the first assembly line.

results.title: The American president
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Castle Rock Entertainment and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: Rob Reiner (A Few good men, Misery, When Harry met Sally) directs this comedy about a fictional American President, who has more than a passing resemblance to President Clinton. Written by Aaron Sorkin (The West Wing, A Few good men) “The American President” is a light-hearted romantic comedy about life in The Oval Office. Democrat president Andrew Shepherd (Michael Douglas) is a widower three years into his term with a 63% approval rating, when he meets the intelligent, attractive Sydney Wade (Annette Bening), an environmental issues lobbyist. Shepherd woos and starts to date Wade, who reciprocates his interest. With an election looming, problems arise when Shepard’s political enemies exploit the situation seeking to hamper his re-election by depicting him as a radical. The private life of Shepherd is scrutinised by the media, raising questions of public responsibility verses ownership of a private life for those living in the media glare. The film is most enjoyable when it takes a behind the scenes look at the machinations of the hectic, compartmentalised life of a president. Also starring Richard Dreyfuss, Martin Sheen and Michael J. Fox, Samantha Mathis, John Mahoney and David Paymer.

results.title: The American parade: we the women
results.brief_description: This factual treatment of the American past balances the unintentional sexism of most US history as now taught. Names like Sarah and Angelina Grimke, Lucretia Mott, Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Sojourner Truth, Susan B. Anthony, and Carrie Chapman Catt will now become familiar through vivid, often humorous, sometimes deeply moving historical dramatizations. This film is an introduction to the American women’s movement. Narrated by Mary Tyler Moore. Associate Producer: Lois Bianchi.

results.title: The American nightmare
results.creator_credit: Independent Film Channel, Paula Jalfon, Colin MacCabe, Jonathan Sehring and Adam Simon
results.brief_description: In this documentary, focusing on horror films from the 60s and 70s, director and screenwriter Adam Simon convincingly argues that the artists crucial to those works (in particular the directors) were reflecting the greater problems facing American society at that time - the Vietnam War, corruption of government, the conflicts of the Civil Rights movement and the divisiveness between generations. Interviews with key directors and scholars is interspersed with extensive clips from films such as “The Last house on the left” and “Night of the living dead” as well as news footage from Vietnam, political assassinations and other terrifying world events. Interviewees include: George A. Romero, John Carpenter, Tom Savini, David Cronenberg, Wes Craven, Tobe Hooper, John Landis. Contains graphic images and please note, some scenes may disturb.

results.title: The American friend [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Road Movies, Filmverlag der Autoren and Wim Wenders
results.brief_description: This film is a result of Wenders’ enthusiasm for Patricia Highsmith’s novels and also of his fascination with America which preoccupied him until his return to Berlin to make “Wings of desire”. The plot, concerning forgery rackets, remains subsidiary to mood. Amidst moving trains and changing landscapes the new world of the American gangster invades the Germany of the dying artisan Ganz. Wenders said that he equates American film directors with gangsters and here cast directors Hopper, Nick Ray and Sam Fuller as the art racketeers.
